channel.title: Green Ruby
channel.description: Green Ruby News is a feed of fresh links of the week about ruby, javascript, webdev, devops, collected by mose every sunday

item.title: Green Ruby News #076
item.description: This week, on jul 25th, Ruby on Rails will have 10 years. And it will also be the annual <a href="http://sysadminday.com/">Sysadmin appreciation day>/a>. It will be a busy friday.
item.content:encoded:
#076 - jul 20th 2014

Edito

This week, on jul 25th, Ruby on Rails will have 10 years. And it will also be the annual Sysadmin appreciation day>/a>. It will be a busy friday.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Making of AprilZero
This website was popular last week, here is the story behind it.
Jam3
Extremely graphic website of a design agency from Toronto. Check their portfolio.
loopalo
A SVG loopy(?) drawing tool. Useless and beautiful.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
CodeMentor
Codementor connects you with expert developers for live 1:1 help..
The Docker Book
(book) new book by James Turnbull, I bought it and I liked it.
Prelang
Web-based GUI for prototyping rails code.
Awesome rails
Another list, this one is about applications made with rails.
Ruby Bookmarks
Curated collection of essential Ruby and Ruby on Rails resources.
Tools of the Trade
Huge list of SaaS services and tools for developers.
Elastibox
Dev And Ops Working Together. Platform for deploying preset stacks.
GoRails
Ruby on Rails screencasts for developers. Nothing to do with Golang.
Drunk User testing
The real way to test usability.
Shoelace
Visual Bootstrap 3 Grid Builder .

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Rubygems 2.4.0
Minor changes, mostly good for gem builders.
Chef Container
Chef gets on the Docker wave.
Xiki
A shell console with GUI features.
OpenProject
Open source project management platform in rails.
Source Han Sans
An open source Pan-CJK typeface, from Adobe and Google.
Pixi.js
2D webGL renderer with canvas fallback.
Mirrorbits
Geographical download redirector for distributing files across a set of mirrors.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Share Rails configuration to Javascript jul 9
Example use of the global gem.
AngularJS for Absolute Beginners jul 15
An easy tutorial for approaching the basics of AngluarJS.
Rails 4 and PostgreSQL Arrays jul 15
Rails 4 supports arrays fields for PostgreSQL in a nice way. Here is how.
Recommended Security Setup for AWS jul 16
How to organize IAM accounts.
18 Surprises From Reading jQuery's Source Code jul 16
Some interesting tricks in there.
Testing Rails Service Oriented Architecture jul 17
Use of remote_factory_girl and remote_database_cleaner for testing remote service.
Configuring Elasticsearch for High Performance jul 18
Elasticsearch Configuration Properties are Key to Its Elasticity.
From big ball of mud to separated concerns jul 18
Part 1 of 6 front-end techniques for Rails developers.
3 Ways to Create Classes in Ruby jul 19
Simple review of class creation, including internal classes with struct.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Goruco 2014 (12 videos) jul 14
The New York event that happened on june 21th.
Edge Caching Dynamic Rails Apps (28m) jul 14
Various insights about CDN and rails.
Sysadmincasts #28 (7m) jul 14
CLI Monday: cat, grep, awk, sort, uniq, spark.
A to Z CSS: @keyframes (6m) jul 15
Animations that are suited to CSS.
What is Flynn: an open-source PaaS (33m) jul 16
Interview with Jonathan Rudenberg, one of Flynn creators.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Giant robots #107 (33m) jul 14
The Best Secrets Kept (Sara Haider).
Product Hunt 14 (48m) jul 15
About reddit’s upcoming mobile app, crack for beards, and the future of Product Hunt .
Ruby5 480 (6m) jul 15
PunchClock, Prelang, Queue Pop with Timeout, Termit, Rails request handling.
Arrested DevOps 15 (57m) jul 15
Continuous Delivery.
TheChangelog 124 (1h04) jul 15
Tedit, JS-Git, and Jack with Tim Caswell.
TheChangelog 125 (1h14) jul 15
Jekyll with Parker Moore.
TheChangelog 126 (1h13) jul 15
Xiki and reimagining the shell with Craig Muth.
Web platform #1 (1h21) jul 16
RubyNation & Ruby's Cultural Impact.
Ruby on Rails Podcast #159 (1h14) jul 16
Flo Motlik - Codeship.
Ruby Rogues 165 (1h05) jul 16
Systems Programming Tricks with Julia Evans.
Javascript Jabber 117 (50m) jul 16
The Koa Framework with Gerred Dillon and Will Conant.
Ops all the things 9 (51m) jul 17
Debug All The Things.
Ruby5 481 (5m) jul 18
Peek, accessibility, polyglot, GoRails, EOL 1.8.7 and 1.9.2.
NodeUp 67 (55m) jul 18
a breach show (the browser written in js).

Devtips

The tips of the week collected from Faria Dev Team ..
Git remerge again a feature branch
Pagespeed insight from the commandline
slice_before for custom splits
Styled checkbox with some css
Browser testing with Sikuli by simulating user actions
Gutter Color for sublimetext3

item.title: Green Ruby News #075
item.description: Ok I will not say a word about football (yes I just did, I know) because xenor and me have opposite positions on this topic. On a more on-topic subject, if you can go to Japan this fall, registration to RubyKaigi opened last week.
item.content:encoded:
#075 - jul 13th 2014

Edito

Ok I will not say a word about football (yes I just did, I know) because xenor and me have opposite positions on this topic. On a more on-topic subject, if you can go to Japan this fall, registration to RubyKaigi opened last week.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
BitShadow Machine
8bit experiment with css boxes.
AprilZero
A guy is self-tracking himself on this website with neat graphic tricks.
Made by Uppercut
Web agency website, cool design and typo work.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Practice Inspiration
A website that suggests random item for practice.
Inch CI
Raise the visibility of code documentation in Ruby.
GerritHub
Gerrit Code Review with GitHub repositories.
Runnable
Run Your Code Online (choice of 15 languages) in a container.
Introduction to Programming with Ruby
(free book) for the inexperienced or completely new programmer.
Auth0
Identity infrastructure, built for developers.
Chef Supermarket
This is the new cookbooks community site from Chef, quite a neat change.
List of lists of Github lists
List of Lists of Github Lists.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Ember 1.6.0
First to be published after converting the codebase to ES6 modules.
Breach
A browser for the HTML5 era. Entirely written in Javascript.
Rails Env Favicon
Gem to display the rails environment on the favicon.
InfluxDB
An open-source distributed time series database with no external dependencies (go + levelDB).
Graphana
Metrics dashboard and graph editor for Graphite, InfluxDB & OpenTSDB (inspired by Kibana).
Odyssey
Create interactive maps by writing stories (on Cartodb).
Vim emoji
Named Emoji in Vim.
CSS Colorguard
Keep a watchful eye on your css colors.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
My Favorite Emacs Add-Ons jul 6
This is just to say that there is not only vim and st3.
Zero to Smoke Test with Sinatra jul 8
Avdi documented the process of retrofitting tests to a test-less Sinatra app.
Metrics in a home jul 10
Presentation of InfluxDB, an alternative to graphite.
Inspiration for custom select elements jul 10
Custom version of the select element.
Web Spreadsheet in 99 lines jul 10
A detailed demo of angular coding, actually.
Pushing Pixels with JRuby+Truffle jul 10
Performances and benchmarks for the truffle engine for jRuby.
Optimising for 60fps everywhere jul 10
Performance and speed in JavaScript.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
A to Z CSS: Justify (6m) jul 8
12 possible values for text-align.
Working with YAML Files (13m) jul 8
How to work with yaml files in ruby.
JS must watch list (33 videos)
Must-watch videos about javascript.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Giant robots #106 (28m) jul 7
Sprinting Thru Design (Alex Baldwin & Galen Frechette).
Product Hunt 13 (43m) jul 7
About what AngelList really is, time-saving apps, and a few crazy products.
Arrested DevOps 14 (1h06) jul 7
How To Eff Up DevOps.
Git Minutes 30 (1h29) jul 7
Luca Milanesio on Gerrit Code Review.
Ruby5 478 (8m) jul 8
Rails 4.1.4, Awesome Ruby, MessageEncryptor, BHF, Inch CI, fourchette.
Ruby on Rails Podcast #158 (1h17) jul 8
Daniel Jalkut - Not a Ruby Programmer (Yet).
Food Fight Show 201407 (1h10) jul 8
About the new community site: Chef Supermarket.
Ruby Rogues 164 (1h17) jul 9
Staying Sharp with Dave Thomas.
Javascript Jabber 116 (1h) jul 9
jQuery UI vs KendoUI with Burke Holland and TJ VanToll.
CodePen 17 (32m) jul 9
What the CodePen community is.
Ruby5 479 (6m) jul 11
Time Travel with git, learn programming, adequate_exposure, Avdi's Sinatra testing adventure, App Server Arena, Informant.

Devtips

The tips of the week collected from Faria Dev Team ..
Coffee to Js in Vim with one key down
Fixed table layout to keep things under control
Nosleep for the insomniac mac
Mute cache in rails logs
Anonymous functions in javascript
Activerecords transaction to save trouble
Reflect on association in activerecord
Tree command as a better ls

item.title: Green Ruby News #074
item.description: This week we had a rails upgrade for security (but only concerns postgres) and another one immediately for fixing a regression in the security fix. It happens sometimes. But there is so much more happening all around. It's very hard to compose this letter because I have to pick news from such a massive amount of new things. But here it is, enjoy :)
item.content:encoded:
#074 - jul 6th 2014

Edito

This week we had a rails upgrade for security (but only concerns postgres) and another one immediately for fixing a regression in the security fix. It happens sometimes. But there is so much more happening all around. It's very hard to compose this letter because I have to pick news from such a massive amount of new things. But here it is, enjoy :)

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Gruber experiments
Various visual web experiments.
Google design
A portal for everything design at google.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Teleport
All about going live somewhere else, maybe remote working.
Tagtree
Screencasts about modern javascript.
Wolfram Cloud
For programming online in Wolfram.
Real Favicon Generator
Generate the favicon pictures and HTML code that work on all major browsers and platforms.
JSON-LD
This is Json plus a linked data layer, just became an official standard at W3C.
Bootstrap carnival
Showcasing 1000+ Bootstrap themes under many different categories.
BrowserTap
Fast and interactive cross-browser testing (in alpha test).
DeployDo
Cloud deployment service with preview.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Rails 4.1.4 jul 2
Rails 4.0.8 and 4.1.4 have been released (security fix on 4.1.3 had a regression).
Docker 1.1.0 jul 3
Various improvements and new features. This is moving fast.
Yt
The most reliable YouTube API Ruby client.
Browser-perf
Performance Metrics for Web Browsers, designed for CI.
Buddha Line Icons Complete
Freebie, 100 line icons.
Longshoreman
Automated deployment with Docker.
Bootstrap 386
Bootstrap theme to make webpages look like they are from the 1980s.
Fast.js
Faster user-land reimplementations for several common builtin native JavaScript functions.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
About Webpage Rendering jun 30
What Every Frontend Developer Should Know: repaint and reflow.
Techniques for mobile and responsive cross-browser testing jun 30
An Envato case study. Pretty good list of tools.
robots.txt disallow: 20 Years of Mistakes To Avoid jun 30
robots.txt has 20 years, here is an update of how they are really used now.
Deb.js: the Tiniest Debugger in the World jun 30
Detailed example of usage of deb.js.
Rails and the Warped Asset Pipeline jul 1
Magics of the asset pipeline explained.
From Rails to RubyMotion: basic toolkit jul 1
Resources and tools for a smooth start on rubymotion.
Ruby blocks precedence jul 1
Blocks have precedence too.
CSS Spheres jul 2
Using CSS gradients to create spheres.
Pixels are expensive jul 3
An addendum to the other article about webpage rendering cited above.
Don’t Use jquery-latest.js jul 3
You shouldn’t be using jquery-latest.js on a production site, here is why.
Farewell Node.js jul 4
A prolific node.js coder looks for new maintainers (express, jade, mocha, ...) now that he moves to golang. He explains why.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
A to Z CSS: ID (7m) jul 1
Some of the reasons why he prefers the class selector over ID.
Ruby Code Reading: Equalizer and Concord (1h26) jun 24
Two Ruby Rogues read over some of the code from rom-rb.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Giant robots #105 (33m) jun 30
Use Your Info-magination (Marc-André Cournoyer).
Product Hunt 12 (43m) jun 30
At Homebrew headquarters with Hunter Walk and Satya Patel.
Ruby5 476 (7m) jul 1
Fast attributes, Yt, Pundit, Active Admin jcrop, fragment caching optout, new Rails versions.
Ruby Rogues 163 (1h16) jul 2
Education with Coraline Ada Ehmke and Katrina Owen.
Javascript Jabber 115 (45m) jul 2
The ES6 Module Loader Polyfill, SystemJS, and jspm with Guy Bedford.
Ruby5 477 (5m) jul 4
rails security, modular migrations, warped asset pipeline, Arel.
Ruby on Rails Podcast #157 (59m) jul 5
Lex Friedman is Hiring a Ruby on Rails Developer for the Midroll Podcast Ad Network.

Devtips

The tips of the week collected from Faria Dev Team ..
CSS line break even inside tables
Profiling Rspec to track long tests
Analytics in Elasticsearch are so fast
Paths in Capybara when there are params
Vim pbcopy to yank to clipboard
SQL in a shell and more from the parallel package
Toggle mockup in background for html/css authoring

item.title: Green Ruby News #073
item.description: One more week of links gathering, here is the summer collection of what you should know about. Well, there is much more if you look further (keep an eye on our links). Enjoy!
item.content:encoded:
#073 - jun 29th 2014

Edito

One more week of links gathering, here is the summer collection of what you should know about. Well, there is much more if you look further (keep an eye on our links). Enjoy!

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Call to Idea
Collection of visual inspirations sorted by category.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Assembly
Interesting concept for crowd-founded, open source startups.
Coders Clan
Get Code Tasks Done.
Apis.io
This is a brand new version of this api search engine.
Learn to Build a Ruby Gem
(book) creating your own Ruby gem from start to finish.
Growing Rails Applications in Practice
(book) Structure large Ruby on Rails apps with the tools you already know and love.
DNS-API
Git-Based DNS Hosting (actually api-only would be more appropriate).
CDN Perf
Compares recent perfs from various js CDNs.
The Best of vim tips
A massive list of vim short tips.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Rails 4.1.2
Rails 4.1.2 and 4.0.6 have been released on june 26.
peco
Simplistic interactive filtering tool for the console.
Bootstrap 3.2.0
Over 1,000 commits since the last release.
Rack secure upload
Rack Middleware to pass user uploads through Antivirus.
Large Hadron Migrator
Online MySQL schema migrations.
Epoch
Real-time charting library for building high performance visualizations.
Ampersand
Non-frameworky framework for building advanced JavaScript apps.
CoffeeKup
Write HTML markup as CoffeeScript.
Pattern Lab
Collection of tools to help you create atomic design systems.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Mongo to Postgres jun 23
Example of a successful migration.
Immutable Infrastructure: Practical or Not? jun 23
Docker revived the trend of immutable infrastructure. But hmm ...
Improve Rails performance by adding a few gems jun 24
Bunch of gems that speed up, in some cases considerably, small parts of Rails.
TDD Antipatterns: The Free Ride jun 24
Description of the piggyback anti-pattern.
The weird Google I/O keynote jun 25
Google I/O didn't go as well as expected.
A Comparison of Popular Ruby Application Servers, part 2 jun 25
After part 1 last week, now some results.
Why you don't need to run sshd in your docker containers jun 26
Details on how to get rid off the ssh addiction in containers.
Designing with Dynamic Content jun 26
Accounting for Variation, .
Includes vs Joins in Rails jun 28
The real difference between includes and joins in activerecords.
build a Ruby gem in 10 steps jun 29
A very detailed walk-through to build a gem from scratch, by Steve Klabnick.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Hover pseudo-class (6m) jun 24
Short screencast about the :hover.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Giant robots #104 (41m) jun 23
Maintaining The Meat Machines (Adam Wiggins).
Arrested DevOps (53m) jun 23
Software Deployment - shipping that software.
Ops all the things 008 (52m) jun 24
High Availability, Disaster Recovery and bunch of acronyms.
Ruby5 475 (6m) jun 24
Mongoid 4, keep a CHANGELOG, Lotus, Growing Rails App, Keep Ruby Weird, ConfConf, RubyForge shut down.
Ruby Rogues 162 (1h04) jun 25
Scaling Rails with Steve Corona.
Javascript Jabber 114 (56m) jun 25
Asynchronous UI and Non-Blocking Interactions with Elliott Kember.
CodePen 016 (34m) jun 27
Blogging (about codepen brand new blogging feature).
NodeUp 66 (55m) jun 27
A nodedown show, node community in Australia.
Ruby on Rails Podcast #156 (1h19) jun 28
Eric Steele - 'What Do I Test?' Book Launch Recap.

Devtips

The tips of the week collected from Faria Dev Team ..
Vim paste buffer to paste again and again
Array literals and interpolation
Photoshop add paper sizes for larger canvas
Left marginal for css positionning
Test true in activerecord
Knife remote command when working with chef-server
Clipping mask in photoshop
Dash offline documentation for mac
Little Ipsum for fake text in mockups
Shell interactive filtering with peco

item.title: Green Ruby News #072
item.description: As a reminder, I still have a bunch of stickers, feel free to ask for some if you want them. And if you like stickers, you also may want to get that one, which is pretty neat.
item.content:encoded:
#072 - jun 22th 2014

Edito

As a reminder, I still have a bunch of stickers, feel free to ask for some if you want them. And if you like stickers, you also may want to get that one, which is pretty neat.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Keylight
A visual musical experience.
Hover effect ideas
Inspiration for subtle hover effects.
All the style guides
All the style guides and pattern libraries from well known websites.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Go bootcamp
(book) Everything you need to know to get started with Go..
Emoji cheat sheet
All the Emoji on a single page with associated code.
Hutt
Video conversations (webrtc and tab sharing) with no login and for free.
Dragdis
A can of bookmarker.
Blogging in codepen
Codepen opened a free blogging hosting service.
Awesome Sysadmin
A curated list of open source sysadmin resources.
Waypoint
A simple tool to keep track of your projects progresses.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
go 1.3
Better performance, improved tools, support for running Go in new environments, etc.
Octicons
Set of font-icons by Github.
Gemoji
Emoji images and names in rails.
Fenix
A simple static desktop web server.
SmallWorld
Utility for generating map overviews.
Miso
Open source toolkit for interactive storytelling and data visualization content.
Web Starter Kit
A Google base for new projects.
Laptop
A shell script which turns a Linux or Mac laptop into a development machine from scratch.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Evaluating Rails Projects jun 12
Methods and metrics to get an idea of the state of a rails app.
Simple Infinite Scrolling with AJAX and Rails jun 16
With Kaminari and some jQuery code.
The definitive guide to Arel jun 16
Behind the scenes, ActiveRecord uses Arel to build the queries.
Automatic eager loading in rails jun 17
Explanation about the goldiloader gem.
Comparison of Popular Ruby Application Servers jun 18
First round of comparison between passenger, thin, unicorn and puma.
A Thorough Guide to Ember Data jun 19
Ember-data changed a lot recently, this post gives a lot of example of use.
mod_spdy is now an Apache project jun 19
Google has formally donated mod_spdy’s code to the Apache Software Foundation.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
JsConf 2014 (12 videos) jun 11
For a total of 5h of video.
Rails 4.1 Message Verifier (11m) jun 15
A brief introduction to Rails Message Verifier.
Phusion Passenger Code Walkthrough (27m) jun 16
Phusion Passenger codebase, shows you how it works and how things fit together.
Ruby Motion Inspect 2014 (19 videos) jun 20
The full track of the rubymotion conf from may 28th.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Giant robots #103 (37m) jun 16
Consulting the Consultants (Adam Wathan, Chris Keithlin).
CodePen 015 (38m) jun 18
Changing Your Mind, evolve your app.
Ruby5 473 (5m) jun 17
New Bundler, AREL, app with Ruby Shoes, attr_searchable, a passenger screencast, and SmartListing.
Ruby Rogues 161 (1h12) jun 18
Docker Deploys with Sam Saffron.
Javascript Jabber 113 (49m) jun 18
Community Dynamics with Reginald Braithwaite.
Ruby on Rails Podcast #155 (1h29) jun 20
Nick Quaranto - rubygems.org, CoworkBuffalo, Nickel City Ruby, aqueousband.net.
Product Hunt Radio 11 (43m) jun 20
About the Fire Phone, Facebook’s new app, Slingshot, and a stupid app called Yo.
NodeUp 65 (55m) jun 20
A campjs show.
Ruby5 472 (5m) jun 20
Ember and Rails tutorial, gemoji, exception googling, dev banners, Grand Central Dispatch, laptop dev setup.

Devtips

The tips of the week collected from Faria Dev Team ..
Avoid fork in threads at least not with multi threads
Git bisect to track where it broke
Merging arrays and remove duplicates
BigText a js lib for justifying big text
SVG in Compass experimental support
Chrome flicker fix and blur fix too
Footer in PrinceXml PDF with some touch of css
Less first for safer file examination
Ruby at_exit for clever process termination

item.title: Green Ruby News #071
item.description: This week I began to publish the links to the resources I use in my weekly review. So checkout the links page on the website if you are interested.
item.content:encoded:
#071 - jun 15th 2014

Edito

This week I began to publish the links to the resources I use in my weekly review. So checkout the links page on the website if you are interested.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Wild as
Talented austrian team of webdevs.
Niice
Design inspiration search engine.
Weio
The Web of Things for Creators.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
NameGrep
Domain name search with regular expressions and curated sets.
Rails 4 Test Prescriptions: Build a Healthy Codebase
(book) Guide to how tests can help you design and write better Rails applications.
JSnice
Makes obfuscated JavaScript code readable.
Kanban tool
Online Kanban board for business with seamless time tracking.
Swift cheat sheet
A good way to get the feeling of that new thing on a one-page sheet.
KickDrop
Beautifully crafted code snippets.
Ember on rails Tutorial
(online book) How to build an Ember app with a Ruby on Rails backend.
CSS Arrow please
Easy builder for css arrows.
Animating float labels using jQuery and CSS3
When the user focuses on an input field individual letters are animated into an HTML fieldset like feel using jQuery.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Docker 1.0
First official stable docker version.
Transpec
A magical tool for converting your specs to the latest RSpec syntax.
Sidekiq-orm
Recurring pattern in sidekiq workers, .
Seed migration
Manage changes to seed data in a rails app in a similar way to how schema migrations are handled.
aIRChat
Browser-based IRC client, with node, running locally.
Centurion
A mass deployment tool for Docker fleets.
Firebug 2.0
This new version has a bunch of new features.
NativeScript
Build iOS, Android and Windows Phone 8 native apps using JavaScript.
Cadvisor
Analyzes resource usage and performance characteristics of running containers.
Taunus
Convention-based, Modular MVC with Shared Rendering in Node.js.
Hexo
A fast, simple & powerful blog framework, powered by Node.js.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Using rails 4.1 secrets for configuration jun 10
An alternative to dotenv setup.
Ruby Security Tools and Resources jun 10
Open source security libraries, web services, and reads about ruby security.
libswarm - Docker Orchestration Announced jun 10
libswarm defines a standard interface to manage and orchestrate distributed systems.
Sharing Data Between Sass and JavaScript with JSON jun 10
Presentation of the sass-json-vars gem.
Digital Design & User Experience Best Practices jun 11
A very long post with illustrated examples on the current state of good UI practices.
Calling C/C++ from Ruby jun 12
Description of few ways of calling C functions from Ruby code.
Rails Development Using Docker and Vagrant jun 13
Make use of the recent vagrant-lxc plugin.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
CSS Float and clear (6m) jun 11
Small screencast about float elements in CSS.
Add Some Jazz to Your Rails App (5m) jun 11
A cool meta-gem gathering useful pry gems for rails dev.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Giant robots #102 (28m) jun 9
Put It Out To The World (Peter Cooper).
Product Hunt Radio 9 (51m) jun 10
About Marco, SF’s on-demand food services, the secrets of online dating and more.
NodeUp 64 (1h19) jun 10
Socket.io v1.0.
Ruby5 471 (8m) jun 10
Rails/Merb Merge in Retrospect, orats, Swift or RubyMotion, RubyMotion 3.0, Docker 1.0, RubyConf Portugal.
Ruby Rogues 160 (1h30) jun 11
Conceptualizing Code with Sam Livingston-Gray and Glenn Vanderburg.
Javascript Jabber 112 (59m) jun 11
Refactoring JavaScript Apps Into a Framework with Brandon Hays.
Arrested DevOps 12 (56m) jun 11
Making The DevOps Transition.
Ruby on Rails Podcast #154 (1h16) jun 12
Greg Baugues - Twilio.
Ruby5 472 (5m) jun 13
Ruby to swift, jazz hands, business gem, invoker.

Devtips

The tips of the week collected from Faria Dev Team ..
S3 backups when you have massive amount of files
Capybara target window to test links with target
Sidekiq dynamic priority by chosing your queue at runtime
Tagbar with Coffeetags for coffeescript in vim
Exception the good way to catch what you really need to catch
Letter opacity because webkit is weird sometimes
Bundle open and read the source of the gems directly
Raw SQL in Rails for faster db manipulation
Parallax with Adobe Edge in a flash kind of UI and export in html

item.title: Green Ruby News #070
item.description: This week I'm adding at the very bottom the devtips of the week. I had some positive feedback about them. So adding quick links may be of interest because they cover the same fullstack webdev topics as this newsletter.
item.content:encoded:
#070 - jun 8th 2014

Edito

This week I'm adding at the very bottom the devtips of the week. I had some positive feedback about them. So adding quick links may be of interest because they cover the same fullstack webdev topics as this newsletter.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Build in Amsterdam
A design company website, with neat navigation.
Airtype
The keyless keyboard of the future.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Sysadmin Casts
imple bite sized sysadmin screencasts (released weekly).
Tech Talks Hub
A listing of Tech Talks.
The Odin Project
Online free courses to learn all about webdev.
Shape Catcher
Unicode character recognition: draw the shape, it gives the code.
FlexJobs
Look for a remote job? give that one a look.
GemBundle
A discovery engine for ruby gems (work in progress).
Go Native
Transform any website in native code for iOS and android.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Rspec 3
Tons of great new features.
Brakeman 2.6.0
This release introduces significant changes to how and when files are parsed.
Dawn
Docker-based PaaS in Ruby.
Logstash pluginbase
A base repo to make Logstash plugins.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Setting up for infrastructure development jun 2
Local MacOSX environment for development and testing with Test Kitchen and Vagrant.
Option pattern in Ruby jun 2
Examples use the Possibly gem.
Why Swift Will Never Replace RubyMotion jun 3
Swift from Apple makes a buzz in iOS dev, but rubymotion is not going to die.
A Rails Development Environment with Docker and Vagrant jun 3
How-to for setting up a rails dev env.
YAGNI methods slow us down jun 4
OutputBuffer subclasses SafeBuffer which forces us to do runtime checks that are probably unnecessary.
Know Ruby: String Accessor jun 4
Deep dive into the use of [] with strings.
The Toolbox Bundler Group jun 4
A clever approach for managing Gemfile content.
PSD Viewing & Diffing on github jun 5
Now gitub supports diff on photoshop files.
Rails 4.1 Enums: How Not to Handle States jun 5
Shout out against blind enum state machines.
The History of Vim jun 5
Small recap of where vim comes from, in preparation of a new vim book.
How I discovered CCS Injection Vulnerability jun 5
History of the discovery of CVE-2014-0224 from last week.
Automating Web Performance Measurement jun 6
The PageSpeed Insights as a node module.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
From Parallel to Concurrent (42m) may 29
Talk of Rob Pike about Golang.
Interview with Deis CTO, Gabriel Monroy (32m) jun 2
Learn more about docker for PaaS.
Introducing the Polymer Designer tool (18m) jun 2
Polymer has an IDE now.
#DOXLON DevOps Exchange – Deployment with Containers (3 videos) jun 3
Polymer has an IDE now.
Using Docker & Ansible by John Minnihan (32m) jun 4
Video from the DevOps track at Gluecon 2014.
Simple introduction to CoreOS (33m) jun 6
Interview with the CEO and CTO of CoreOS, Alex Polvi and Brandon Philips.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Giant robots #101 (39m) jun 2
Developing Skills (Alex Fox, Jatin Bhandari).
Product Hunt Radio 8 (37m) jun 3
About betaworks new mobile game, anonymous social apps in schools, various other things.
Ruby5 469 (7m) jun 3
RSpec 3, Git 2, bower-rails, JSON responses with PostgreSQL, serialization & enumeration.
Ruby Rogues 159 (1h26) jun 4
Hacking Education with Saron Yitbarek.
Javascript Jabber 111 (1h08) jun 4
The Ember.js Project with Erik Bryn.
Food Fight Show june 2014 (1h12) jun 4
Chef Metal with it's creator, John Keiser.
Ruby on Rails Podcast #153 (1h11) jun 5
Ben Hundley - elasticsearch & Qbox.
Code Pen 014 (34m) jun 5
Security in Codepen.
Ruby5 470 (5m) jun 6
Rails and Sinatra, Protocol Buffers, HTTP API design, dat science.

Devtips

The tips of the week collected from Faria Dev Team ..
Wrap nil with try and avoid errors
Codemirror for mail templates and limit user errors
Git 2 push from matching to simple
fs_usage debug for js compilation
Photoshop custom sharpen with a cloned overlay
Media queries from scratch because small is beautiful
Vim leader key from outer space
Make a gem it's simpler than what it looks
Restore user data from a mysql db

item.title: Green Ruby News #069
item.description: Last week I officially launched at Faria, my current employer, a public tips website called Faria Dev Tips. I has a lot in common with Green Ruby. The topics covered are the same, it covers rails, ruby, js, devops, design, css, with the same fullstack approach. The origin of it is also very similar. Both come from internal communication and evolve to open sharing. Check it out, you may like it :)
item.content:encoded:
#069 - jun 1st 2014

Edito

Last week I officially launched at Faria, my current employer, a public tips website called Faria Dev Tips. I has a lot in common with Green Ruby. The topics covered are the same, it covers rails, ruby, js, devops, design, css, with the same fullstack approach. The origin of it is also very similar. Both come from internal communication and evolve to open sharing. Check it out, you may like it :)

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Letters Inc
Creative agency from japan.
XSS game
An educational training to understand about javascript web vulnerabilities.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Faria Dev Tips
Dev tips from the Faria team, a dozen per week.
Compressor.io
Compress and optimize your images, up to 90% file size reduction.
Front-end Feeds
An up to date list of RSS feeds for front-end developers.
A Hacker’s Guide to Git
Written for people who already use Git, and want and advanced peek.
Endless domains
Domain suggestion tool for new gTLDs.
SubToMe
Makes it easy for people to follow web sites.
hi.diplo
Git history, deploy notifications and project events in a single timeline interface.
100+ Interesting Data Sets for Statistics
Looking for interesting data sets?
Learn Angular
Learn AngularJS with free interactive lessons.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Rails 4.1.2rc1
With bug fixes with a final release in the next few days.
Writefully
Uses github as the publication engine for a CMS.
Writefully
Uses github as the publication engine for a CMS.
Knod
A Tiny HTTP server for your current directory.
Samson
A web interface for capistrano deployments.
SocketIO 1.0
What's new in this first major release.
Headroom
Hide your header until you need it.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
RubyMotion 3.0 Sneak Peek: Android Support may 27
They are looking for testers.
Go, REST APIs, and Pointers may 27
Lessons from designing go-github, with focus on the patch operation.
MetaRuby - Building Classes Dynamically may 28
Learn how to dynamically build classes in Ruby.
Writing a Domain-Specific Language in Ruby may 28
An example of building a DSL.
How You Nest Modules Matters in Ruby may 28
There are various ways, and differences.
The Design Of SQLite4 may 28
SQLite4 is an alternative to the v3, not a replacement.
Git v2.0.0, what changed may 29
Git v2.0.0 is slightly backward-incompatible, here is where.
New Units for Responsive Designs may 29
Viewport Units for More Flexible Size Definitions.
10 Most Common Web Security Vulnerabilities may 29
.. and recommendations on how they can be avoided.
Why I Use GistBox may 31
A personal feedback from a Gistbox enthusiast.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Giant robots #100 (1h) may 26
Adequately Industrious (with Aaron Patterson).
Product Hunt Radio 7 (46m) may 27
About music apps, location-sharing products, and the best new thing since the GIF.
Code Pen 013 (40m) may 27
Talk about backups behind codepen.
Ruby Rogues 158 (57m) may 28
Confessions (essentially about testing practices).
Javascript Jabber 110 (38m) may 28
Zones with Brian Ford.
Ruby on Rails Podcast #152 (1h04) may 29
Oren Dobzinski - Desk.com.
The Changelog #123 (1h15) may 29
Gittip and Open Companies with Chad Whitacre.
Ruby5 468 (5m) may 30
Magical Routes, rest-client, PostGIS with Google Maps, SSL with rails, Rails vs. Sinatra, dev blogging.

item.title: Green Ruby News #068
item.description: Testing is a hot topic recently in the rails community. Reminds me of this image. But to tell you the truth, I'm not gonna stop unit testing, even if it's not enough. So, what is new this week? As usual, a bunch of things.
item.content:encoded:
#068 - may 25th 2014

Edito

Testing is a hot topic recently in the rails community. Reminds me of this image. But to tell you the truth, I'm not gonna stop unit testing, even if it's not enough. So, what is new this week? As usual, a bunch of things.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
808 cube
A beatbox in html in 3d, careful it can be hypnotic.
Web field manual
Various links and guidelines for modern web development.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Oozled
Curated resources for everything design related.
HTTP API Design Guide
HTTP API design guide extracted from work on the Heroku Platform API.
Web Api gap
A comparison of various features and APIs across mobile platforms.
RAML
RESTful API Modeling Language.
Captain icon
A free set of 350 vector icons and a cool design for the website.
Opbeat
Extends GitHub, tracks releases, catches Python/Ruby/Node.js exceptions.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Ruby 1.9.3-p547
Very minor released, only fixes an SSL issue with old libs.
Devise 2 factor
Barebones two-factor authentication with Devise.
Simple token authentication
Simple (but safe) token authentication for Rails apps or API with Devise.
DoBy
Automatically expiring TODO notes in Ruby.
ActiveJob
Declare job classes that can be run by a variety of queuing backends.
Smart Listing
AJAX-enabled data lists with support for sorting, filtering and in-place editing.
OSWAP Mantra
It's a browser and a security toolkit.
Honey Badger
Honeybadger will dig up juicy informations about the site you are on.
Famo.us
A JS framework focused on modern animation and transformation, definitely graphical.
Jr static
Static web generator that moves the 'generator' part to the browser.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
About Martini may 19
Martini has lived, now Negroni is the new idiomatic web framework.
Git Undo by Example may 21
Some common recovery scenarios.
Alert Design may 21
Sometimes the alerts do little more than tell us that something went bump.
Notable Changes in RSpec 3 may 21
3.0.0 final is just around the corner.
Caching in Rails 4 Applications may 22
Focus on some ways to handle cache in rails 4 with memcached and/or varnish.
How to handle big repositories with git may 22
Some ideas and techniques to deal properly with the different categories of huge repo.
Inspiration for article intro effects may 22
Some inspiration for effects applied to title headers of articles with a fullscreen image.
Crowdfunded RVM 2.0 may 23
Lists what is planned for the new RVM 2.0.
Upgrading to Ruby 2.1 may 23
Perfs improvements and how YAML parsing changed.
Next-Generation Responsive Web Design Tools may 23
Review of Webflow, Edge Reflow and Macaw

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Rails 4.1 variants (3m)
How to setup and use the new Rails 4.1 feature variants..
OpenStack 2014 (38 videos) may 20
The videos os the OpenStack Summit Atlanta 2014.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Giant robots #99 (20m) may 19
You Are Not Alone (Greg Baugues about mental illness).
The Changelog #122 (1h13) may 19
Rails Girls Summer of Code and Travis Foundation with Anika Lindtner and Floor Drees.
Product Hunt Radio 6 (44m) may 20
About time-saving products, new startup funding options, and fertility apps.
Ruby5 466 (6m) may 20
Unexpected new Ruby, plenty of SMTP, Discovery Tests, building ROM, Windows ExecJS, Napybaras, and dangerous :nodocs: .
Code Pen 012 (39m) may 21
Talking about VC funding.
Arrested DevOps 11 (1h) may 21
DevOps at Etsy: Not a Unicorn, Just a Sparkly Horse.
Ruby Rogues 157 (1h23) may 21
Book Club – Object Design Book Club with Rebecca Wirfs-Brock.
Javascript Jabber 109 (46m) may 21
Dependency Injection in JavaScript with Vojta Jína & Misko Hevery.
Ruby on Rails Podcast #151 (1h25) may 23
Ross Penman - 15 yr old Scottish programmer.
Ruby5 467 (5m) may 23
Rspec3 rc1, ActiveJob, Devise-two-factor, Camcorder, Teaching kids of Pis, Weirich on Exceptions.

item.title: Green Ruby News #067
item.description: This week may be a good time to book your ticket for RedDot rubyconf in Singapore, it's not full yet. For the rest, here is our weekly list of links, now sent to 250 subscribers in 45 different countries (I updated the map last week).
item.content:encoded:
#067 - may 18th 2014

Edito

This week may be a good time to book your ticket for RedDot rubyconf in Singapore, it's not full yet. For the rest, here is our weekly list of links, now sent to 250 subscribers in 45 different countries (I updated the map last week).

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Purple Rock Scissors
Very nice website from a digital creative agency.
Best keyboards for programming
Such an important peripheral. Maybe you need a new one ?
Spurious Correlations
Totally fantasist data correlations, quite a taste of British humor actually.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Ruby backports
Service to backport gems to discontinued versions of Ruby or Rails.
NerdyData
A Search Engine for (HTML) Source Code.
mkdown
Mkdown renders Markdown GitHub gists with alternative CSS.
Finch
View your local websites on any internet connected device.
Trolldor
The global blacklist of twitter trolls. Also show some stats for any twitter account.
Web Compat
Bug reporting for the internet.
OAuth Security Cheatsheet
Bad OAuth is an easy backdoor. Learn and secure.
Tutum
Run, monitor, and scale Docker containers.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Padrino 0.12.2
Ruby lightweight web framework silently makes its progress.
AniJS
Declarative handling library for CSS animations.
Octotree
Chrome extensions to display GitHub code in tree format.
Byebug
Debugging in Ruby 2.
Simple calendar
Easy rendering a calendar in rails.
CoreOS
Linux for Massive Server Deployments.
Shepherd
Shepherd is a javascript library for guiding users through your app.
Tmuxinator
Manage complex tmux sessions easily.
SyncThing
Open Source Continuous Replication / Cluster Synchronization Thing.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
New rails 4.1 travel_to test helper may 11
Would it be the end of the timecop?
Morphing buttons concpet may 12
An inspirational example for buttons that become what you click towards.
Getting into OpenSource with LookingForPullRequests may 13
If you wonder where to start participating, this could be a good way in.
Intro++ to Go Interfaces may 13
Interfaces are one of it's best features in go, but they can be confusing.
Eight Terminal Utilities for OS X Command Line may 14
open, pbcopy, mdfind, screencapture, launchctl, say, diskutil, brew.
Docker is the heroku killer may 14
Some thoughts from a docker addict.
Test Isolation Is About Avoiding Mocks may 15
Isolated testing done test-first exposes design mistakes before they're made.
Rails idioms considered harmful may 17
Something encourages us to treat our Rails apps as if they are simply a web interface to the database.
Remote access to Docker with TLS may 17
Use an exposed secure port instead of the local socket.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
The DHH Problem (3m)
3 mins talk about DHH's effect, fun to watch.
Introduction to Polymer (20m) may 12
The Next Generation of Web Development - Matthew McNulty.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Giant robots #98 (20m) may 12
Memorization Techniques (Chris Hunt from github).
Code Pen 011 (31m) may 13
Licenses, Terms of Service and Privacy Policy.
Product Hunt Radio 5 (39m) may 13
Home screen apps, Swell, Semil’s approach to investing, and washing vegetables in the shower.
Ruby5 464 (6m) may 13
Ruby 2.1.2 and 2.0.0, Jekyll 2.0, CVE Dispute, Rails Batched Queries, FiniteMachine.
Ruby on Rails Podcast #150 (58m) may 14
Jamis Buck - Basil & Fabian (formerly of 37signals).
Ruby Rogues 156 (1h13) may 14
Hardware Hacking with Julia Grace.
Javascript Jabber 108 (46m) may 14
AngularJS with Igor Minar.
Ruby5 465 (5m) may 16
Quill, free programming books, OAuth Security Cheatsheet, Ahoy email, Mailkick.
